fields.System.Title: 1.1.1 - Complete Discovery for Migration Environment
fields.System.Description:
• The discovery is completed for the scoped VMs
  • The assessment for the environment is created within Azure Migrate. Waves of migration are also defined for execution.
  • The assessment was exported as an Excel file to your local machine.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 1.1.3 - Convert the XSLX Assessment into a CSV
fields.System.Description:
On your local machine, transfer the Azure Migrate Assessment excel file to the local src folder and navigate to the folder.
Using the provided PowerShell script
Open a PowerShell session in terminal, navigate to the folder and run with the command: 
.\convert-xlsx-to-csv.ps1 -fullFilePath "<file-path>"
The expected output is 2 CSV sheets from the assessments: All_Assessed_Machines.csv and All_Assessed_Disks.csv.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 1.1.2 - Set up DevOps Organization and PowerShell Assets
fields.System.Description:
• An Azure DevOps Organization is created and linked to your subscriptions in Azure.
  • The src folder is cloned on your local machine.
  • PowerShell and Excel are installed on your local machine.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 1.2.1 - Create a project in Azure DevOps
fields.System.Description:
• Create an Azure Repos repository within the project to use for hosting the files from the src folder 
    • Here is where you will also add the two CSVs that were the output of the provided script, All_Assessed_Machines.csv and All_Assessed_Disks.csv into the repository within Azure Repos.
  • Create an Azure Pipeline where it is sourced from the Azure Repo that hosts the templates.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 1.2.2 - Azure DevOps Project Settings Configuration
fields.System.Description:
• Create a service connection to use within your Azure DevOps environment for resource deployment purposes.
  • In the Azure portal, create a resource group (named based on the migration wave/app that is being deployed) within your Azure environment for your resources to be hosted in
    • Ensure that the Service principal that is created with this service connection (with the naming convention <organization>-<project-name>-<subscription-id>) has the appropriate permissions (listed below) in order to create resources within Azure.
      • Roles: Virtual Machine Contributor, Network Contributor

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 1.2.3 - Azure DevOps Repo Setup
fields.System.Description:
This file structure will be auto created for you within the repo (can also be found under the src folder)
Note: With the virtual machines that are created in the script, the default for Linux machines are Ubuntu OS.

Details:

  • All_Assessed_Machines.csv and All_Assessed_Disks.csv: CSV files extracted from Azure Migrate Assessment excel file
  • scripts: folder to store powershell files for executing different test and validation scripts

    Note: Test scripts are to be developed based on needs for your migration environment. (Recommendation is to develop them in PowerShell)

  • pipeline-script.ps1: script that deploys compute resources
  • testing folder: used for test migration purposes
    • testing-pipeline.yml: file for testing in an isolated or migration VNet
    • testing-variables.yml: variables used in powershell and pipeline yaml
  • rehost folder: used for rehosting migration resources
    • azure-pipeline.yml: file for rehosting VMs in a specified migration VNet
    • variables.yml: variables used in powershell and pipeline yaml
      • Manually populate the variables.yml using CSV recommended values and what is expected in Azure.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 1.3.1 - Set up variables needed for the CI/CD pipeline in a variables.yml file based on the environment
fields.System.Description: 1.3.1 - Set up variables needed for the CI/CD pipeline in a variables.yml file based on the environment

fields.System.Title: 1.3.2 - Example Pipeline Stages for Redeployment/Rehosting of Migration Waves
fields.System.Description:
• Initialize Redeployment of Servers 

      • Validate the Migration Pre-requisites 

      • Initialize the Redeployment utilizing input parameters (CSV, variables.yml) 

    • Dry Run 

      • Ensure that all the appropriate constructs are in the environment 

    • Start Deployment of Servers 

    • Validation of Environment

fields.System.Title: 2.1.1 - Testing Pre-Requisites - From Redeployment/Rehosting
fields.System.Description:
To get started, the assumption is the following:
  • The discovery is completed for the scoped VMs
  • The assessment for the environment is created within Azure Migrate.
  • The assessment is the source for where the VMs in the pipeline are created. Please ensure that only the VMs that are scoped for the test environment are in the assessment. Please manually omit VMs not needed in the deployment.
  • The assessment was exported as an Excel file to your local machine.
  • An Azure DevOps Organization is created and linked to your subscription in Azure.
  • The src folder is cloned on your local machine.
  • PowerShell and Excel are installed on your local machine.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 2.1.2 - Isolated VNet Pre-Migration Tasks
fields.System.Description:
Please refer to the Pre-Migration and Post-Migration Activities page that should be defined before executing the test pipeline. General best practices when preparing for test migration:
  • Isolated VNet
    • Define parameters needed for an isolated VNet implementation (i.e. CIDR block, NSG Ports that will open on the test subnet, etc.).
    • Test the connectivity in the isolated (Guidance for identifying target VNet)
    • Ensure that appropriate stakeholders are given the least privilege permissions to execute the pipelines.
    • Define Test Migration approach through waves of execution
      • Understand dependencies to create migration waves/groups.
      • Define test cases.
      • Ensure Rollback plan is in place for the re-hosted VMs.
      • Make sure that test data is consistent with the data used in production.
    • Clean up test resources that were deployed in an isolated VNet.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 2.1.3 - Production VNet Pre-Migration Tasks
fields.System.Description:
Production VNet
  • Define parameters needed for the production VNet
  • Plan a maintenance window to shut down on-prem workload for test migration, set up a VNet with the parameters needed for production workloads to move to Azure
  • Define test cases for the environment
  • Choose non-prod VM Migration group to start the test functionality with.
  • Perform tests on a smaller VM waves of the workloads first.
  • Ensure Rollback plan is in place for the re-hosted VMs.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 2.2.1 - Input Parameters for Test VNet Variables
fields.System.Description: Input parameters your environment using the testing-variables.yml as a template.

fields.System.Title: 2.3.1 - Block a maintenance window when executing the CI/CD Pipeline
fields.System.Description: 2.3.1 - Block a maintenance window when executing the CI/CD Pipeline

fields.System.Title: 3.1.1 - Pipeline Stages to Consider for Migration Waves
fields.System.Description:
Please refer to the Milestone: Redeployment/Rehosting of Migration Waves page in order to have the correct setup for this deployment.
  • Reference Migration Tasks: Milestone: Wave Migration and Post Go-Live
  • Note: The assessment CSV acts as the source of deployment information for the migration wave execution via the Azure Pipeline. Please ensure that once the CSVs are created that the unscoped VMs from the All_Assessed_Machines.csv and All_Assessed_Disks.csv files are manually omitted.
Pipeline Stages for Migration utilizing the provided template.
  • Setup Cutover Window within the pipeline
    • Ensure that there is a backup of the servers before cutover
  • Initialize Migration
    • Declare input parameters and modify Target Subscription
  • Start Migration
    • Migrate via pipeline specifications in migration waves
  • Have rollback plan ready for execution if needed (send traffic to previous server)

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 3.2.1 - Setting variables for Migration Waves
fields.System.Description: Based on the migration wave, manually fill in variables needed for the CI/CD pipeline, using the variables.yml file as a template.

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 3.3.1 - Post Migration Activities (optional)
fields.System.Description:
• Validate connections to the VMs that were done in the Testing Phase now that the cutover is complete
  • BCDR Considerations
    • Backup of Servers
      • Can be executed via Azure Policy with Azure Backup:
        • DevOps Task
        • Policy
    • Enable Azure Site Recovery for Disaster Recovery
      • Tutorial to set up Azure VM disaster recovery with Azure Site Recovery
  • Deploy Azure Disk Encryption to help secure disks and keep data safe from theft and unauthorized access
  • Maintenance of Shared Image Gallery with Azure DevOps for the releases of New Images/Image Versions
  • Monitoring of Cloud Assets Through Azure Monitor
    • Workbooks
      • Library of Application Insights Workbooks

attributes.comment: Making a new link for the dependency
attributes.name: Parent

fields.System.Title: 2.1.4 - Testing PowerShell Scripts
fields.System.Description:
Create the appropriate scripts that correlate to the types of tests needed for your deployment:
  • Smoke Test
  • UAT
  • Failover

fields.System.Title: 2.2.2 - Create a Testing Pipeline Yaml Workflow
fields.System.Description:
Create a testing-pipeline.yml for resource execution using the provided template as a baseline. Below are a description of the tasks:
Pipeline Tasks:
  • Start Test Migration
    • Create isolated VNet (optional)
    • Within Powershell script:
      • Create the Migration Group Compute needed
  • Validate Test Environment (manually or using test scripts)
    • Run Testing Scripts (if applicable)
      • Smoke Test
      • UAT
      • Failover
  • Clean up Test Resources

fields.System.Title: 2.2.3 - Validate Target VNet Tests
fields.System.Description:
• If execute the isolated VNet Testing Pipeline, validate the pipeline has ran through the necessary tasks above.
  • If utilizing the final Migration VNet, set the maintenance window and prepare migration waves for execution using the sample pipeline template for migration.
  • If any of the tests fail within a pipeline stage, execute the Rollback plan for the migration wave.

fields.System.Title: 2.2.4 - Post Test Migration Tasks
fields.System.Description:
• Validate VM migration was successful and that applications are functioning as expected
    • Perform capacity testing to ensure that functioning properly in production

Expected Results
  • VNet created with specified parameters for testing its functionality before full migration of servers to Azure
  • Standardized pipeline to utilize for deploying compute resources in Azure
  • Pipeline provides option for executing tests within Azure on the testing resources that are deployed
  • Pipeline performs clean up of test resources after validation of functionality

fields.System.Title: 3.2.2 - Migration Pipeline Creation
fields.System.Description: Create a migration-pipeline.yml for resource execution using the templates as a starter pipeline.

fields.System.Title: 3.2.3 - Migration Pipeline Execution
fields.System.Description: Execute the pipeline for the appropriate migration wave and environment.
